title: 113_hr3202
content: The Act titled "Essential Transportation Worker Identification Credential Assessment Act" mandates a comprehensive security assessment of the Transportation Security Card Program. The Secretary of Homeland Security must provide a comprehensive assessment of the transportation security card program's effectiveness in enhancing security for facilities and vessels. The assessment will evaluate how well the program addresses security risks in the maritime environment. The Secretary of Homeland Security must assess the transportation security card program's effectiveness in addressing security risks in the maritime environment. A corrective action plan with implementation benchmarks and potential program reforms must be submitted to relevant committees within 60 days. The Comptroller General will review the corrective action plan within 120 days. The Secretary issues a corrective action plan to implement recommendations from national laboratories and the Comptroller General. The Comptroller General reviews the plan and informs relevant committees. The Secretary cannot issue a final rule on transportation security card readers until the Comptroller General informs the committees. The Secretary issues an updated list of transportation security card readers compatible with active transportation security cards. This does not apply to any final rule issued regarding TWIC-Reader Requirements. The Comptroller General oversees the implementation of recommendations and informs relevant committees every six months for three years after the corrective action plan is issued. The Comptroller General reports to relevant committees every six months for three years after issuing a corrective action plan. No additional funds are authorized for this Act and its amendments, using existing available amounts.
